intro: Heracleum alpinum subsp. juranum, commonly known as the Alpine cowparsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
